attributes.action: Introduce free menstrual cups into schools & food banks to reduce envir. impact
attributes.additional_details:
The government have introduced free sanitary products to reduce period poverty but what if they could also reduce the environmental impact? 

On average, 1 female will use around 11,000 tampons in their life, Which ends up in landfill/sea/beaches.  

1 menstrual cup can last many years & would reduce sanitary waste that is created.

Menstrual cups are a safe an eco-friendly alternative to tampons & towels.  

Its time to change the cycle of single use sanitary products.
attributes.background:
What if we could tackle period poverty & the environmental impact of single use sanitary products?

No-one should need to chose between eating/attending school or personal hygiene. 

By giving out free menstrual cups to women & girls in schools & food banks, this would no longer be an issue.

rejection.details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/236651

Food banks aren't run by the UK Government or Parliament. You could start a new petition calling for the Government to provide free menstrual cups for anyone getting benefits instead if that is something you would to see happen.
